qas.question: Does inheritance work differently in plants?
What plant did Mendel use to demonstrate inheritance?
What other plant was used in the discovery of different genes?
Are plants and animals genetically the same?

context: Inheritance in plants follows the <a0_0>same fundamental principles of genetics<a0_0/> as in other multicellular organisms. Gregor Mendel discovered the genetic laws of inheritance by studying inherited traits such as shape in <a1_0>Pisum sativum (peas)<a1_0/>. What Mendel learned from studying plants has had far reaching benefits outside of botany. Similarly, "jumping genes" were discovered by Barbara McClintock while she was studying <a2_0>maize<a2_0/>. Nevertheless, there are some <a3_0>distinctive genetic differences<a3_0/> between plants and other organisms.
